  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER REPORTED TO DOOR 400. WEARING PROPER PPE USED THE DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEETS FOR FLAMMABLE LIQUID. BOX WAS ON THE FLOOR. BOX WAS WET ON BOTTOM CORNER. NO LIQUID ON THE FLOOR. NO NEED FOR ZEP ZORBENT. PLACED THE BOX IN A GREEN PLASTIC DMP BAG AND REMOVED IT TO THE DMP CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report E-2024090572
item.description:
Report E-2024090572

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-02T09:14:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-19
  • City: WEST MIDDLESEX
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Miller Environmental Group was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 1ft-by-1ft area of the concrete dock floor and estimated that one (1) cup of material was released due to a crack in one (1) 330-gallons poly tote. Miller Group personnel transferred the remaining product to a new poly tote and cup up the damaged bladder tote. The cup-up tote and impacted cardboard was containerized into one (1) 55-gallon metal drum. The generate waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

item.description:
Report E-2024090558

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-27T09:15:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-20
  • City: GREENCASTLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: When loading freight into trailer forklift operator was running the pallet of drums they were loading into the trailer and rubbed against the trailer wall and a rivet that was protruding sliced opened one of the drums consequently contributing to the unintentional release. Spilled material was cleaned with absorbent and placed into a recovery container as was the compromised container.

item.title: Report E-2024090521
item.description:
Report E-2024090521

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-27T09:15:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-19
  • City: PHILADELPHIA
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ROADRUNNER TRANSPORTATION SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 19, 2024, at 1508 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Roadrunner personnel in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania regarding the release of Clean Pro Isopropyl Alcohol (UN1219, 3, II). Terminal personnel reported that a total of 1 gallon was released from (2) 5-gallon metal pails that were dropped by a broken skid while being moved. Terminal personnel cleaned the release with absorbents and generated (2) 5-gallon DFs of waste that was then staged onsite pending disposal.
